availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Moses Block (Louisville, Kentucky, fancy store owner)

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, fancy store owner. Native of Bavaria. Married to Fanny Oberdorfer Block. Father of Dora Block, Carolina Block, Clara Block, Joseph Block, and Amelia Block. Owner of fancy store in Louisville in 1860. Member of the German Hebrew congregation of Adath Israel in Louisville.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 8, p. 226; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Jefferson County, Louisville, Ward 9, p. 10; Find A Grave, "Moses Block (1809-1882)," Memorial #64946875, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=64946875 (accessed June 21, 2017).
